name: Corporate Strategy
long_desc: This course is designed to provide the student with a general management perspective and an understanding of the total business enterprise. It builds upon previous course work in functional areas and provides insights and analytical tools which a general manager should have in order to plan and implement successful business strategy. The student will analyze complex business problems and formulate realistic strategic solutions. Emphasis is placed on the practical application of business theory by the student in their business career.

custom_fields.goals: Enables you to formulate an effective strategy for any company in any industry and be able to support that recommended strategy with specific analysis.
custom_fields.key_topics: Strategy formulation, strategy consulting, corporate strategy.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Recommended knowledge of microeconomics, finance, and accounting. Ideal level of knowledge would be junior year. Sophomores will find the course to be challenging, but valuable if you wish to get a summer internship as a consultant
custom_fields.assessment_structure: In-class presentations (many), class participation, and a large final project. Two individual exams
custom_fields.relevance: Ideal training for people who plan to be strategy or general management consultants.
custom_fields.learning_resources: No text. All reading material is provided.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: There will be team meetings outside of class time to prepare for presentations.
